intro: Hedeoma rzedowskii, commonly known as the Mexican thyme, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and hairy, aromatic leaves. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands. Hedeoma rzedowskii is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional medicine for its antiseptic and anti-inflammatory effects.
